titleproper.value:
Guide to the Arthur H. Landis Oral History Collection
          <num>ALBA.AUDIO.066</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Wendy Scheir, June 2004; Gail Malmgreen, 2012

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace
        <date>2017-09-07T19:44:29</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Arthur H. Landis Oral History Collection

abstract.value:
Arthur H. Landis (1917-1986) went to
        Spain in 1937 as a volunteer with the 15th International Brigade and fought with the
        MacKenzie-Papineau Battalion. In 1967, Landis wrote <emph render="italic">The Abraham
          Lincoln Brigade</emph>, a general history of American volunteers in the Spanish Civil War,
        and later published <emph render="italic">Spain! The Unfinished Revolution</emph>, about the
        political complexities of the war. The Landis collection of audiotapes consists primarily of
        interviews with American Spanish Civil War veterans conducted in the 1960s as part of his
        research for <emph render="italic">The Abraham Lincoln Brigade</emph>. A few miscellaneous
        tapes recorded for other purposes are also included.

p.value:
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
        Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment,
        tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date;
        Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert
        F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South
        <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

For further biographical information on Arthur Landis, and for more information on the
        audiotape project see, Arthur H. Landis Papers, ALBA #66.

The availability of CD reference copies and audiocassettes copies in indicated in the
        entries for individual items. Reel-to-reel tapes labeled "not transferable" in the
        descriptions were damaged or posed other serious problems that prevented transferring them
        to CD.

corpname.value:
Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Brigada Internacional,
        XV

dsc.value:
Series I: Reel-to-Reel Tapes, 1962-1965. Conditions Governing Access

Access copies for some recordings are available by appointment for reading room listening only. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives with collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

 Barsky, Edward; Duncan Keir, Jr. [audiocassettes 66-72, 66-73, 66-74] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 1 Bevensee, Court; and Moe Fishman. Second and Last Session on Brunete and Bevensee's comments on the draft of Landis' book. [audiocassette 66-75] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 2 Blair, John; and [Cohn Haber?] Discussing the structure of the MacKenzie-Papineau Battalion and joining the 15th Brigade outside of Quinto. [audiocassettes 66-76, 66-77, 66-78, 66-79] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 3 Brandt, Joe. [audiocassettes 66-80, 66-81, 66-82, 66-83] [Not transferable] undated 1 66- 4 Brown, Archie; George Foucek; Sidney Levine; and Donald Thayer. On re-crossing of the Ebro. [audiocassette 66-84] (CD reference copy available) Oct 31, 1964 1 66- 5 Brown, Archie; George Foucek; Sidney Levine; and Donald Thayer. Continuing the discussion of Gandesa, while Foucek describes activities leading up to Hill 666. [audiocassette 66-85] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 6 Cane, Lawrence (Larry); and Carl Geiser. [audiocassette 66-86] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 7 Cane, Lawrence (Larry); and Milton Wolff. [audiocassette 66-87] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 8 Chaiken, George; and Felix Kusman. Kusman discusses the action at Quinto and Belchite, and what the company did on the first, second and third day at Quinto. [audiocassette 66-88] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 9 Chesler, Frank; and Max Robert Klonsky. Klonsky describes late 1936 when he agreed to go to Spain and how he went to the Army & Navy store in lower Manhattan to get equipment. [audiocassettes 66-91, 66-92] [Not transferable] undated 1 66- 10 Chesler, Frank; and Robert Thompson. Discussing Fuentes del Ebro on the Aragon Front where [?] commanded the MacKenzie-Papineau Canadian Battalion. [audiocassettes 66-89, 66-90, 66-93] undated 1 66- 11 Van Clute, Wilton; Nick (Mike) Pappas; and Kenneth R. Shaker. [audiocassettes 66-94, 66-95, 66-96, 66-97] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 12 [Colow, Maury?]; and Moe Fishman [audiocassette 66-75] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 13 Colow, Maury; Milton Wolff. [audiocassettes 66-98, 66-99] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 14 Davidow, Ruth; George Foucek; Donald MacLeod; and Wilbur Ed Wellman. [audiocassettes 66-79, 66-101] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 15 Durem, Rebecca (Schulman). Landis: "It was my understanding that the State Department...threw a little difficulty in your way before the first group [of nurses] got its passports..." [audiocassettes 66-146, 66-147] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 16 Eider, Louis. [audiocassettes 66-102, 66-103] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 17 Fishman, Moe; and Harold Smith. "Bryce Coleman, whose body I saw outside of Villanueva de Canada..." [audiocassette 66-151] (CD reference copy available) Jun 1, 1964 1 66- 18 Fisher, Harry; Steve Nelson; Charles Nusser; and Harold Smith. On Brunete. [audiocassettes 66-123, 66-131, 66-141] (CD reference copy available) Apr 1964 1 66- 19 Foucek, George; Sara Houlihan; Ruth Keller; Donald MacLeod; Donald Thayer; Wilbur Ed Wellman. After the Belchite Action. [audiocassette 66-108] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 20 Foucek, George; Sidney Levine; Donald MacLeod; and Steve Nelson. Added Material on the Ebro; Terrain at the Battle of Aragon. [audiocassettes 66-104, 66-109] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 21 Foucek, George; Sidney Levine; Donald MacLeod; and Donald Thayer. Teruel. [audiocassettes 66-105, 66-106, 66-107] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 22 Goddard, Howard Owen; Evelyn Hutchins; and Gabriel Jack Quinones [audiocassettes 66-81, 66-112, 66-113] undated 1 66- 23 Goddard, Howard Owen; Evelyn Hutchins; and Gabriel Jack Quinones [audiocassettes 66-112, 66-114] [Reel-to-reel tape is inaudible; try cassettes] undated 1 66- 24 Goff, Irving; and Harold Smith. "Johnson was in command of the base, DeWitt Parker was commissar..." [audiocassettes 66-115, 66-116] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 25 Gittelson, Lester; Herman Klein; Max Robert Klonsky. Gittelson: "I was with the original GW Battalion, but... in July 1937, we became part of the ALB because... most of the men in the GWB and the ALB were either killed or wounded. I recall the day of the first major offensive vividly..." [audiocassettes 66-120, 66-126] [Not transferable] undated 1 66- 26 Goff, Irving; Benjamin Goldstein. On Fuentes. [audiocassettes 66-117, 66-118] [Not transferable] undated 1 66- 27 Groden, Daniel Samuel [audiocassettes 66-119, 66-120] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 28 Harriman, Manny; and Allan Donald McNeil. "I had in my possession ...[documents that] were seized by the Eastern [?] Committee while I was in Pittsburgh during the infamous Jewish Cultural Center situation..." [audiocassette 82] undated 1 66- 29 Harriman, Manny; William Gilmore Wheeler. Harriman on MacKenzie-Papineau Battalion at Ebro; Wheeler on Jarama. [Not transferable] [audiocassettes 66-159, 66-160] undated 1 66- 30 Kaufman, Rubin. [audiocassette 66-96] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 31 Keller, Fred Paul. [audiocassettes 66-121, 66-122, 66-123] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 32 Keller, Fred Paul; Abraham Osheroff. [audiocassettes 66-103, 66-107, 66-124] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 33 Klein, Herman. On first week in September, 1938, in the Sierra Caballs: "I was in the Third Company of the Lincoln-Washington under the command of Bill Wheeler..." [audiocassettes 66-125, 66-129] Dec 1965 1 66- 34 Klein, Herman; and Steve Nelson. [audiocassettes 66-83, 66-137, 66-138] [Not transferable] undated 1 66- 35 Klein, Herman; Charles Nusser; and Max Robert Klonsky. On Brunete; "...Martin Hourihan wounded in the April 5th attack? He was."; comments on the draft of Landis' book. [audiocassette 66-128] (CD reference copy available) Apr 3, 1965 1 66- 36 Klein, Herman; Charles Nusser; Max Robert Klonsky; and Harold Smilth. Smith, commander of battalion headquarters company on the staff structure and events surrounding the loss of Lardner; Nusser or Klonsky on issues concerning the publication of Landis's book. [audiocassette 66-127] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 37 Landis, Arthur; and Isadore Tivin. Landis demonstration tape, with instructions for veterans on how to make tapes; experience with MacKenzie-Papineau Battalion; Tivin on arrival at Albacete and training camp in Madrigueras. [audiocassettes 66-156, 66-157] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 38 Levine, Sidney; Donald MacLeod; Donald Thayer; and Wilbur Ed Wellman. Landis: "This tape is an excellent introduction"; MacLeod with transport, and covers a much wider field; Thayer on fighting in both towns as a lieutenant; Wellman on fighting with Lincolns at Quinto and taking of Hill 666; taking of Belchite. [audiocassettes 66-133, 66-134] (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 39 Levine, Sidney; Donald Thayer. Primarily on Brunete Front. (CD reference copy available) undated 1 66- 40 Love, Vaughn Costine; Steve Nelson; and Louis Secundy. Love on reasons why, as a black man, he volunteered for the SCW. [audiocassettes 66-143, 66-158] (CD reference copy available) Apr 3, 1965 2 66- 41 MacLeod, Donald Transport unit called the 2nd Regiment de Tren on Brunete. [audiocassettes 66-131, 66-132] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 42 Munday, Arthur; and Charles Nusser. [audiocassette 66-136] (CD reference copy available) Mar 7, 1965 2 66- 43 Nelson, Steve. Nelson: "When the Madrid campaign was over, all the men... wanted to get back to Paris..." [audiocassettes 66-97, 66-142] (CD reference copy available) Jul 4, 1964 2 66- 44 Nelson, Steve; and Charles Nusser. Nelson's response to criticisms of Landis about quality of earlier tapes: "I have perhaps as much information as any single American who was in the Brunete campaign... " [audiocassette 66-139] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 45 Nelson, Steve; Charles Nusser; and Harold Smith. [audiocassette 66-104] (CD reference copy available) Apr 1964 2 66- 46 Nelson, Steve; and Al Warren. Nelson: "I arrived in Albacete somewhere around the middle of April in 1937. We came in from France by a little fishing boat... ran into an Italian destroyer on the way..." [audiocassettes 66-93, 66-158] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 47 Parker, Max. From the First Transport Regiment, Prisoner [audiocassettes 66-144, 66-145] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 48 Sennett, William [and Songs?]. [audiocassettes 66-142, 66-148, 66-149] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 49 Smith, Harold. Equipment of Washington Battalion when they went into Brunete... [audiocassette 66-150] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 50 Stuart, Yale. [audiocassettes 66-132, 66-152, 66-153] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 51 Taft, Anne (I). Side 2: "One day...a truck drove up and Dr. Bethune arrived with a refrigerator and blood for transfusions, and set up the transfusion service for us..." [audiocassette 66-155] [Not transferable] undated 2 66- 52 Taft, Anne (II). [audiocassette 66-154] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 53 Thayer, Donald. Current Medical Problems. [audiocassette 66-126] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 54 Unknown Interviewee. Jarama. [audiocassette 66-128] (CD reference copy available) undated 2 66- 55 Zlotnick, Louis. From Chicago to New York to France, and Over the Mountain to Spain... [audiocassettes 66-129, 66-143] undated 2 66- 56 Series II: Miscellaneous Reel-to-Reel Audiotapes, 1945-1970. Conditions Governing Access

Access copies for some recordings are available by appointment for reading room listening only. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
